summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from August 9, 2019, providing updates on the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. It covers progress on financial forfeiture, victim identification and interviews, co-conspirator outreach, and the status of evidence analysis. The email reveals the scale of the investigation, including the identification of approximately 60 victims and the pursuit of assets and co-conspirators.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; his financial assets and LLC companies are being pursued for forfeiture.

events.title: Appraisal of Epstein's NY Residence
events.description: A certified appraisal was completed for Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence, valuing it at $86,250,000.

events.title: Investigation Status Update
events.description: FBI provides an update on the Epstein investigation, covering victim interviews, co-conspirator outreach, financial forfeiture actions, and evidence analysis.

keyFacts: Approximately 60 victims have been identified, with potentially hundreds more unidentified; over 20 victims have been interviewed.
Victims reported sexual abuse at multiple residences including New York, Florida, Little St. James, and New Mexico, with about 6 victims specifically identified in relation to abuse in New York.
Epstein's New York residence was appraised at $86,250,000, and a notice of pendency was filed as part of forfeiture proceedings.
Multiple subpoenas have been served on Epstein's LLC companies based in the Virgin Islands.
All co-conspirators have been served except one who resides in London; one co-conspirator has been cooperative and provided corroborating information.
